pr_title: DB-10483 Support DEC and DECIMAL functions

timeline.message: DB-10483 ascii art, make multiary function node table human-readable.

timeline.bodyText: I think you can remove that reference. We will have our own documentation.
timeline.author: arnaud-splice

replies.bodyText: I would rather keep it for reference (even our documentation will be mirroring that some way of the other I think).
replies.author: hatyo

timeline.bodyText: Why not construct a SQLDecimal directly from the string?
timeline.author: arnaud-splice

replies.bodyText: The string could contain invalid characters, it could also contain a comma for example and decimal separator(s), I want to catch as many of these errors as possible giving corresponding error messages before actually parsing it into decimal.
replies.author: hatyo

timeline.author: dgomezferro

timeline.bodyText: Isn't this removing the decimalCharacter? How do we use it later?
timeline.author: dgomezferro

replies.bodyText:
After seeing the ITs I think you are using as "digit group separator" but I'm pretty sure it's supposed to be the "fractional separator". From the docs:

it can appear at most once in string-expression

and

Digits are truncated from the end of the decimal number if the number of digits to the right of the decimal separator character is greater than the scale scale. An error is returned if the number of significant digits to the left of the decimal character (the whole part of the number) in string-expression is greater than precision - scale
replies.author: dgomezferro

replies.bodyText: You're right, I glimpsed over that, thanks for pointing it out.
replies.author: hatyo
